content.title: Venous Duplex Ultrasound Protocol
content.definition: A standardized ultrasound examination of the lower extremity venous system combining B-mode imaging with pulsed-wave Doppler to evaluate for deep vein thrombosis and venous reflux.

clinical_features.compression: Primary criterion - lack of complete compression indicates thrombus
clinical_features.spectral: Absent or reduced respiratory phasicity suggests proximal obstruction
clinical_features.segments: CFV, FV, popliteal, tibials (whole-leg vs limited)

concepts.definition: Protocol for chronic venous insufficiency assessment.

clinical_features.mapping: Identify all sources of reflux and perforators

concepts.definition: Anatomic evaluation of the venous system.

clinical_features.gsv: Size, depth, course, presence in saphenous compartment
clinical_features.perforators: Location, size, competence of incompetent perforators

concepts.definition: Key elements in the venous duplex report.

clinical_features.sensitivity: >95% for proximal DVT, 85-95% for distal DVT

sources.reference: Lurie F et al. J Vasc Surg Venous Lymphat Disord. 2020;8:339-367
Zierler RE et al. J Vasc Ultrasound. 2018;42:99-112
